titleStmt.title: His graces answer by Dean Swift----

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Dear Smed, I read thy Brillant Lines
Where wit in all its glory shines;
Where compliments with all their pride
Are by thy Numbers Dignify'd;
I hope to make you Yet as clean
As that Same, viz: S,t Patricks Dean
I'll give ye Suplice, verge, & stall,
And may Something else with·all
And were you not so good a writer
I Shou'd present you with a Mitre.
Write worse then──if you can──be wise
Beleive me tis the way to Rise.
Talk not of making of thy Nest;
Ah! never lay yṭ head to rest!
That head so well with wisdom fraught
That writes without the Toil of thought.
While others rack their Busy Brains
You are not att the least of Pains.
Dean, to your Deanery repair
And build a Castle in the Air
I'm Sure a man of your fine Sence
Can do it with a Small expence.
Then your Dear Spouse, & you together
May Breath your Belly full of AEther.
When Lady Luna is your Neighbour
She'll help your wife when she's in Labour;
Well skill'd in Midwife Artifices
For she herself oft falls to Peices.There you shall see a Raree show,Will make you scorn this world below,
When you Behold ye Milky way
As white as snow as Bright as Day
The Glittering constellations roul
About ye grinding Artick Pole;
The lovely Tingling in Your Ears
Wrought by the musick of ye Spheres.
Your spouse shall then no longer Hector
You need not fear a Curtain Lecture
Nor shall she think she is Undone
for quitting her beloved London,
When she's exalted to yẹ skies,
She'll never think of mutton pies,
When you're advanc'd above Dean viz:
You'll never think of Goody Griz:
But ever, ever, live att Ease
And thrive & strive your wife to Please,
In her you'll Center, all your Ioys,
And get 10000 Girls, & Boys,
10000 Girls & Boys You'll Get,
And they like Suns shall rise & Set
While you & spouse transform'd shall Soon
Be a New Sun, & a New moon:
Nor shall you strive your horns to hide
For then your horns shall be your pride.361-176Y
